cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 55 miles W of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: continuing NNW today, turning north tonight and then N-NE Wednesday, crossing north-Florida Gulf Coast and sweeping northeastward across Georgia toward the Georgia/South Carolina coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north Florida Gulf coast (Big Bend area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of St. Marys River, GA to South Santee River, SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: None for Georgia coast (warnings confined to Florida Gulf Coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf coast, north-Florida Big Bend, Georgia coast, South Carolina coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35-45 mph gusts) possible Wednesday night through early Thursday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding possible (<3 ft) but no surge watch/warning issued for Georgia coast
weather_observation.rainfall: 3-5 inches with isolated totals up to 8 inches, risk of flash and urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes possible Wednesday night-Thursday; hazardous seas and rip currents
